page.title: 01GAZETTEER,WITHERNSEA
page.content: Withernsea is a small seaside resort on the east coast 20 miles from Hull,with approximately 5,000 permanent inhabitants.It is backed by the flat farming lands of Holderness and a network of often narrow roads link the town with a number of small villages.The town is dominated by the disused lighthouse,situated several hundred yards inland.Coastal erosion is a constant threat and strong sea defences have had to be constructed. Although a holiday resort the main season is short and most holidaymakers stay on caravan and chalet sites.The town has a sand and shingle beach with safe bathing.Protection is afforded by an RNLI inshore lifeboat.The only significant feature on the seafront is a castellated gateway,the sole remains of a pier.Currently the town is best renowned for its open market.
